attributes.action: Instruct all Local Health Authorities to provide free evening and weekend ante-natal classes at least for all parents expecting their first baby
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I am expecting our first child and was disgusted to first be told that we could have a weekend course and then when we signed up to it be told that they had cut the courses due to money. We were offered a one day course for a few hours at 2pm in the afternoon on a weekday, not exactly practical when both of us work.
With the announcement of £1.8bn surplus does this seem fair or just?
As a result to fit in around working - which most of us have to do these days to get by, we have had to pay £135 to get a course through the National Childbirth Trust, please support getting this unfair and unjust system to work for normal working class people. Help us first time parents feel a little more valued, better informed and less isolated.
